wms_article.title: Dongbu swings to profit in H1 on cost reduction efforts

wms_article_body.body: Dongbu Corp. said Thursday it swung to a profit in the first half, posting an operating income of 16.6 billion won ($12.12 million), up 128.3 percent from a year earlier. Sales fell about 4 percent to 829.4 billion won, while net income rose 113.2 percent to 10.7 billion won. The company’s cost ratio dropped to about 87 percent from over 100 percent a year ago, supported by a higher share of high-margin projects, tighter cost control, and the completion of sites that had carried heavy cost burdens last year. Its debt-to-equity ratio improved by roughly 16 percentage points to 248 percent. The order backlog stood at around 10.9 trillion won at end-June. New wins included a 340 billion won package for Section 1 of the Busan New Port–Gimhae Expressway and nearly 600 billion won in urban-renewal projects across Seoul, including in Mangwoo-dong, Gocheok-dong, and Cheonho-dong, bringing total new contracts across public, private, and overseas businesses to more than 1 trillion won in the first half. “We delivered meaningful results across profitability, stability, and growth in the first half, and will expand high-value projects while diversifying our portfolio and strengthening risk management in the second half,” a company official said.
